responses: Hello! Welcome to the Leo Club of Uva Wellassa University. How can I help you today?

patterns: Tell me about Leo Club UWU
responses: Leo Club UWU is a student-led volunteer organization under Lions Clubs International. We focus on leadership, experience, and opportunity through community service.

patterns: Tell me about Leo Club activities
What kind of programs does Leo Club run?
responses: Leo Club organizes community service projects, leadership training sessions, awareness campaigns, and fun social events.
We engage in volunteering, environmental activities, youth empowerment programs, and more!

patterns: Why should I join Leo Club?
What do I gain from Leo Club?
responses: You gain leadership skills, service experience, and the opportunity to connect with like-minded youth.
It's a great way to make a difference in your community and build a strong resume.

patterns: How can I contact Leo Club?
responses: You can contact us via our official email or visit the Contact Us section on our website.
Reach out on our social media pages or send an inquiry through our website.

patterns: Can we collaborate with Leo Club?
responses: Yes! We're open to collaborating on community projects and initiatives. Please contact us with your proposal.
We welcome partnerships that align with our mission. Let's make a difference together!
Our vision is: 'Let's build a team, Let's build a vision, Let's build a plan, Let's build success.' We are committed to a path of purposeful community impact and youth empowerment.

Our mission is to provide a unique platform for UWU undergraduates to develop leadership skills and create meaningful change through service. We aim to empower youth through impactful initiatives and global connections.

patterns: When did UWU Leo Club start?
responses: The Leo Club of Uva Wellassa University (UWU Leos) was officially established on September 18, 2022. It was chartered during the "Lumos '22" installation ceremony, sponsored by the Lions Club of Uva Capital, held at the UWU campus in Badulla. Leo Club UWU was formed to inspire leadership and service among students. We are now one of the most active clubs in District 306 C2.
The club embraces the motto "Servite Vel Relinquo" (Latin for "to serve or to leave") and follows the theme:

patterns: Why does Leo Club UWU exist?
responses: To provide a unique platform for undergraduates of Uva Wellassa University to develop leadership skills, nurture their personalities, and foster meaningful changes within their communities through impactful service initiatives. To create a friendly environment that offers infinite leadership experiences and opportunities for young people, forming new bonds within the global Leo and Lions network while focusing on community service.

The club is led by an Executive Committee, including President, Secretary, Treasurer, and Directors. For the Leoistic year 2025/26, the club is proudly led by Leo Deshan Thilakarathne as the President.
Undergraduates at UWU can apply via our website and pay the membership fee.
Our annual membership fee Rs.500 and its affordable and used to support club activities. Renewals happen annually.
Members develop leadership, teamwork skills, earn certificates, and contribute to meaningful projects.

patterns: What projects does the club do?
responses: Our projects include education, environment, health, blood donations, and charity work. There are a lot of project categories.
Yes, we organize annual Installation Ceremony, Leo photoshoot, signature projects and Leo's night.

We have been recognized within District 306 C2 for leadership, innovation, and outstanding service. The Leo Club of Uva Wellassa University proudly marked a number of remarkable achievements at Resiliencia'24, the 19th Annual District Award Ceremony of Leo District 306 C2, held on 7th July 2024. Leo Erandini Ambalampitiya was awarded as the Most Outstanding Zone Director (Winner) and also recognized as the 1st Runner-Up for Most Outstanding Immediate Past President. Leo Abishek Haththakage secured the 1st Runner-Up position for Most Outstanding Bulletin Editor. The club was honored as the 2nd Runner-Up for Most Outstanding University-Based Omega Leo Club. Among project recognitions, the club received 1st Runner-Up for Best Project in Peace, Religious and Cultural Activities for the project සොකරි නාඩගම by Leo Nimeshika Perera, 2nd Runner-Up for Best Project in Youth Empowerment for Fortune Secret by Leo Chathumali Lankeshvara, and 2nd Runner-Up for Best Project in Fellowship for Leo's Trophy by Leo Sahan Madushka. In addition, the District President's Appreciation Awards were presented to Lion Shiraz Khan (Club Advisor), Leo Erandini Ambalampitiya (Council Officer), Leo Kirula Pramod (Club President), Leo Nimeshika Perera, and Leo Hansi Shaneesha in recognition of their valuable contributions throughout the Leoistic year.
Thank you for your interest, but volunteering is limited to registered Leo Club members only.
Members can submit project ideas through our website or directly to the committee.
We organize leadership workshops, Leo Camps, and skills development programs regularly.
Check our 'Events' page on the website or our social media for upcoming activities.
The Leoistic year runs from July to June, following Lions Clubs International guidelines.

patterns: Which district is UWU Leo Club in?
Tell me about Leo District 306 C2
responses: The Leo Club of UWU belongs to Leo District 306 C2, which is part of Lions Clubs International in Sri Lanka. This district connects many Leo Clubs across the region, promoting leadership and service through collaborative projects.

patterns: How many types of Leo Clubs are there?
Difference between Alpha and Omega Leo Club
responses: There are two types of Leo Clubs: Alpha Leo Clubs for youth aged 12–18 and Omega Leo Clubs for young adults aged 18–30. Leo Club UWU is an Omega club.
International Leo Day is celebrated every year on December 5th to recognize Leos around the world for their community service and leadership.
Leoism is the spirit of leadership, experience, and opportunity. It reflects the values of service, teamwork, and youth empowerment that guide all Leo Club activities.

patterns: How big is Leo Club worldwide?
responses: Yes, Leo Clubs are international! They exist in over 140 countries and have more than 170,000 members globally, all dedicated to service and leadership.

patterns: What is the motto of Leo Club?
responses: The official motto of Leo Club is 'Leadership – Experience – Opportunity.' It defines our goal to develop young leaders through service.

patterns: Do Leos get pins or awards?
responses: Yes, active Leos can receive pins, certificates, and awards for their leadership, volunteering hours, and contribution to projects. These recognitions come from the club, district, or Lions International.

patterns: What are the positions in a Leo Club?
responses: Leo Clubs are structured with an executive committee that includes a President, Vice President, Secretary, Treasurer, and Directors for specific areas like membership, projects, and IT.

patterns: What's the difference between Leo and Lions Club?
Are Leo and Lions the same?
responses: Leos are the youth wing (age 12–30) of Lions Clubs International. While Lions are adult volunteers, Leos are young leaders who serve under Lions' guidance and gradually transition to Lions as they grow.

patterns: How to join Lions after Leo?
responses: Yes! Leos are encouraged to become Lions after age 30. Their experience as Leos helps them take on stronger roles within Lions Clubs International.
